intro: Morisia acaulis, commonly known as the naked stem morisia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, leafless stems that rise directly from the ground. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland fynbos vegetation. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
